basics.name: Li-Cheng Xu
basics.label: AI4S Researcher
basics.summary: A researcher working at the forefront of AI applications in chemistry, developing machine learning approaches to solve fundamental challenges in chemical synthesis, molecular modeling, and physical science

work.name: Shanghai Academy of Artificial Intelligence for Science
work.position: Researcher of AI for physical science
work.summary: Applying cutting-edge deep learning techniques to build structure-performance relationships for chemical reactions

publications.name: Enantioselectivity prediction of pallada-electrocatalysed C-H activation using transition state knowledge in machine learning
publications.summary: We developed a machine learning model that can predict the enantioselectivity of pallada-electrocatalysed C-H activation reactions based on transition state knowledge. (First author)

publications.name: Towards Data-Driven Design of Asymmetric Hydrogenation of Olefins: Database and Hierarchical Learning
publications.summary: We built a large database of asymmetric hydrogenation reactions and developed a hierarchical learning model to predict the enantioselectivity of these reactions. (First author)

publications.name: A Molecular Stereostructure Descriptor Based On Spherical Projection
publications.summary: We designed a molecular descriptor based on spherical projection which could capture subtle variation of molecular steric environment. (First author)

publications.name: Transfer Learning-Enabled Ligand Prediction for Ni-Catalyzed Atroposelective Suzuki-Miyaura Cross-Coupling Based on Mechanistic Similarity: Leveraging Pd Knowledge for Ni Discovery
publications.publisher: Journal of the American Chemical Society
publications.summary: We developed a transfer learning model that can predict the ligand for Ni-catalyzed atroposelective Suzuki-Miyaura cross-coupling reactions based on the mechanism similarity of Pd-catalyzed reactions. (Co-first author, third position)

publications.name: Electrocatalyzed direct arene alkenylations without directing groups for selective late-stage drug diversification
publications.summary: We developed a electrocatalytic method for direct arene alkenylations without directing groups for selective late-stage drug diversification. (Co-author)

publications.name: Reaction performance prediction with an extrapolative and interpretable graph model based on chemical knowledge
publications.summary: We developed a graph neural network based on chemical knowledge to predict the reaction reactivity and selectivity of chemical reactions. (Co-author)

publications.name: Data-driven design of new chiral carboxylic acid for construction of indoles with C-central and C-N axial chirality via cobalt catalysis
publications.summary: We developed a machine learning method to guide the design of new chiral carboxylic acids for the construction of indoles with C-central and C-N axial chirality via cobalt catalysis. (Co-author)

publications.name: Exploring Spectrum-based Molecular Descriptors for Reaction Performance Prediction
publications.summary: We proposed a novel spectrum-based molecular descriptor for reaction performance prediction. (Co-author)

publications.name: Bridging Chemical Knowledge and Machine Learning for Performance Prediction of Organic Synthesis
publications.summary: A review discussing the integration of chemical knowledge and machine learning for performance prediction of organic synthesis. (Co-author)

publications.name: When machine learning meets molecular synthesis
publications.summary: A review discussing the integration of machine learning and molecular synthesis. (Co-author)

publications.name: Predicting Regioselectivity in Radical C-H Functionalization of Heterocycles through Machine Learning
publications.summary: We developed a machine learning model to predict the regioselectivity of radical C-H functionalization of heterocycles. (Co-author)
